channel.title: Any1 an expert with pc's about ports and port forwarding
channel.description:
right i have just upgraded from 30 mb to 60 meg and got the new super hub, the only problem i have with the super hub is the PORTS, everything esle is ok. i'll explian my problem with the ports now. i host mine craft servers and runescape private server. so the ports i open are 5555, 43594, 43595, and the mine craft one ( witch i changed to 255) and everything was ok till one day my whole net and cable goes off, so i rang vm and they sent a new moden out ect, i installed it, everything was working again, the ports were open easy to forward. then i got sick of being on 30 meg internet so i upgrated to the 60 meg, ( it's only been installed for 2 days) in that time just to get "ANY" port chcker site to say port 80 is open i have tryed : dmz dnz static ip, reseting the moden, puting it just into moden mode, and ive tryed taken upnp off and puting it on and nothing seems to work for opening ports. so i thought well is it just me or is it every1 ive been ooking around and it seems to be only me. so i thought. i went to my sister house who is also on 30 meg with superhub. her ports are closed on 8 diffrent port checker sites. o i thought i'd test my dads and yet again his is all closed to. so im now thinking has VM stopped all porting incoming. ive rang them and they said its not a fault on there side its mine. so how would it be mine if 3 diffrent people with 3 diffrent post codes all have closed ports... HOW THE HELL IS IT MY FAULT. i guess you et my point now any1 able to help please eply and let me know maybe it is my fault with a setting on my computer but ive formated it 3 times and stil no luck ... any1 have any ideas ?
ps sorry about this being messy ect its just a post i copyed from virgim media's forums that i typed a week ago and had no reply on there so trying here.

item.title: Any1 an expert with pc's about ports and port forwarding
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Post a screen capture of ipconfig, and a screen capture of the router page where you port forward

you might be doing something wrong?

Read full topic
item.source: Any1 an expert with pc's about ports and port forwarding

item.title: Any1 an expert with pc's about ports and port forwarding
item.dc:creator: @jamespk jamespk
item.description:
@jamespk wrote:

its the latest superhub so its a router/ modem the info i found out is

Information: Cable Modem EuroDOCSIS

Boot Code Version: 2.3.0beta7

Software Version :R36

Hardware Version :2.00

CA Key Installed

Read full topic

item.title: Any1 an expert with pc's about ports and port forwarding
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

what router are you using

are you using any firewall

just a fyi I’m on virgin media and have absolutely no trouble forwarding ports on my router

Read full topic
